hadiths.english_translation: Narrated through the chain: Uthman sent Sulayt ibn Sulayt and Abdur-Rahman ibn Attab ibn Usayd to Ibn Salam, saying: 'Go to Ibn Salam and disguise yourselves as if you are Bedouins from Atawiyya, then tell him: Unrest has befallen the people as you can see, so what do you command us?' They came to Ibn Salam and spoke to him in this manner. He said to one of them: 'You are so-and-so son of so-and-so,' and said to the other: 'You are so-and-so son of so-and-so. The Commander of the Believers sent you. Give him my greetings and inform him that he will be killed, so let him desist, for that will be stronger for his argument before Allah on the Day of Resurrection.' They came to him and informed him. Then Uthman said: 'I charge you that no one of you fights with me.' Marwan said: 'And I charge myself to fight,' so he fought and was struck upon his neck. He continued lying with his chin upon his chest until he died.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Aban: He said that Salam informed me from Abdullah ibn Rabah, saying: I and Abu Qatadah entered upon Uthman while he was besieged. We asked his permission for Hajj, and he granted us permission. We said: O Commander of the Believers, a matter concerning these people has befallen us as you can see, so what do you command us? He said: 'Hold to the congregation (Jama'ah).' We said: 'We fear that the congregation may be with those who oppose you.' He said: 'Hold to the congregation wherever it may be.' He said: We went out from him, then I met al-Hasan ibn Ali entering upon him. We returned with him to hear what he would say. He said: 'Here I am, O Commander of the Believers, command me with your command.' He said: 'Sit, O son of my brother, until Allah brings about His affair, for I have no need of the world, or he said: of fighting.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri from Urwah, saying: I and Ubayd Allah ibn Adiyy ibn al-Khiyar entered upon Aisha. We mentioned Uthman, and she said: 'O, would that I had been something forgotten and left forgotten. By Allah, I did not violate anything concerning Uthman except that the same was violated concerning me, until if I had wished for his killing, I would have been killed.' Then she said: 'O Ubayd Allah ibn Adiyy, let not anyone deceive you after the group whom you know, for by Allah, the deeds of the companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ were not belittled until the readers who criticized Uthman were tested. They recited a recitation not like it, and prayed a prayer not like it, and fasted a fast not like it, and spoke a speech we cannot speak like it. When I considered the craftsmanship, I found they did not approach the companions of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. So when you hear the beautiful speech of a man, then say: "Work, and Allah will see your deeds and His Messenger and the believers" from Surah At-Tawbah, verse 105, and let not anyone deceive you.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ayyub from Abu Qilabah from Zahdim, saying: We were with Ibn Abbas one day, and he said: 'By Allah, I will surely tell you a hadith that is neither hidden secret nor open proclamation - it is not hidden so I conceal it from you, nor is it open so I preach with it. Indeed, when they attacked Uthman and killed him, I said to the son of Abu Talib: Avoid this matter, for you will be dealt with, so spare yourself. But he disobeyed me, and I do not think he will succeed. By Allah, Mu'awiyyah ibn Abu Sufyan will surely prevail over you, because Allah said: "Whoever is killed wrongfully, We have given authority to his heir" from Surah Al-Isra, verse 33. By Allah, Quraysh will surely conduct themselves among you in the manner of Persia and Rome.' He said: We said: 'What do you command us, O Ibn Abbas, if we encounter that?' He said: 'Whoever among you takes what he knows is right will be saved, and whoever abandons it while you too abandon it, will be like one of these generations that perished.'

Bring me the Jami'ah (collective statement of pact) and the sword.' Then al-Hasan and Ibn Abbas stood and said: 'O Commander of the Believers, we beseech you by Allah!' hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Ali ibn Zaid from al-Hasan from Qays ibn Ubadah, saying: We were with Ali and whenever he witnessed a sight, or looked over a hill, or descended into a valley, he would say: 'Allah and His Messenger have spoken the truth.' I said to a man from Banu Yashkur: 'Let us go to the Commander of the Believers until we ask him about his saying: Allah and His Messenger have spoken the truth.' He said: We went to him and said: 'O Commander of the Believers, we saw you whenever you witnessed a sight, or descended into a valley, or looked over a hill, you would say: Allah and His Messenger have spoken the truth. Did the Messenger of Allah ﷺ make a covenant with you regarding this?' He said and we pressed him, so when he saw that, he said: 'By Allah, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ did not make any covenant with me except something he made with all people. However, the people attacked Uthman and killed him. In this matter, others were in worse condition and worse action than me. Then I saw that I was the most deserving of this matter, so I overtook it. Allah knows if we were right or wrong.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Zayd ibn Aslaim: A man from the Ansar was sheltering under a Sarahah tree (Acacia tree). Umar passed by and said: 'Do you know why the shade of the Sarahah is beloved?' He said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Why?' He said: 'Because its shade is cool and it has no thorns.' He said: 'And for something else. Do you see, when you are between the two mountain passes (al-Ma'zamayn) below Mina, from that place to the sunrise there is the place of As-Surar, or he said: the mosque of As-Surar. Seventy prophets were granted their prayers in it. One of the prophets sheltered under a Sarahah tree, made supplication and it was answered for him, and he made supplication for it and it was protected as you see it now. It does not decay as sorcery decays.' Ma'mar said: 'Surru' (they were granted): their tombs were cut off. La ya'tallu (does not decay): meaning it does not become hollow from beneath ever.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Zayd ibn Aslaim, raising it to the Prophet ﷺ, saying: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'From the best of your deeds is what you love to be known.' Zayd said: And if he (someone) conceals it, Asalam would still be more appropriate for him, and he loves it to be known.

narrators.name: Zayd ibn Aslaim
narrators.full_name: Zayd ibn Aslaim al-Qurshi (Mawla of Umar)
narrators.alternative_names: Zayd ibn Aslaim, freed slave of Umar

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim
narrators.alternative_names: Ahmad, al-Mustafa, the Messenger of Allah

chainIssues: This is a marfu' (elevated to the Prophet ﷺ) hadith but with only one narrator between the collector and the Prophet ﷺ
The chain is very short and Zayd ibn Aslaim is Saduq, not in the highest grade
Zayd ibn Aslaim's direct hearing from the Prophet ﷺ is questionable given his status as a freed slave born around 50 AH

potential_issues.issue: Weak narrator (Saduq) transmitting from the Prophet ﷺ
potential_issues.impact: Zayd ibn Aslaim is classified as Saduq (truthful but with some weakness in precision). His transmission directly from the Prophet ﷺ needs scrutiny
The extremely short chain raises questions about the transmission - there is no complete documentation of all narrators in the chain from the Prophet ﷺ to the collector
Zayd ibn Aslaim was born around 50 AH, which is at the end of the Prophet's life or after. Direct transmission from the Prophet ﷺ is highly questionable

hadiths.IISGrade: Problematic
